Anastasia (Anya).Action: Rushes downstairs late for the party, showing a sense of urgency and responsibility to join an important event despite being young.
Being late to an important royal event, indicating possible disorganization or difficulty managing time.
Reassures Sonya by saying no one will notice her being late.
Flashes a mischievous smile and descends the staircase in grand style after becoming the center of attention.
Kicks the ribbon to Sonya without breaking stride, maintaining composure.

Sees Dmitri eyeing the fruit hungrily and tosses him an orange without missing a dance step.

Without missing a dance step, she grabs an orange off the tray and tosses it to Dmitri, showing awareness and quick, subtle kindness.

Cuddles Grandmama and shows longing to be together in Paris, cherishing a meaningful gift and embracing her.

Shows no overtly skillful, confident, or intelligent behavior in the scene; mostly reacting emotionally and somewhat passively to unfolding events.
Rushes to stand in front of her father to protect him despite fear, boldly confronts Rasputin with 'We're not afraid of you!'
Stands up bravely in front of Rasputin to protect her father and family, asserting that they are not afraid despite her shaking hands.
Bolts upright alertly upon hearing shots, showing quick awareness.
Stops dead while being hurried to safety and insists on retrieving her music box, then runs back alone despite dangers.
Refuses to board the train without Tatiana, urges her to hurry and insists on pushing her up the stairs first.
Refuses to board the train immediately, insisting on pushing Tatiana up the stairs of the caboose despite the chaos.

Continues cleaning and taking care of herself in the orphanage while others seem resigned or indifferent.
Reaches out and grabs Tatiana's hand, tells her not to let go despite the danger.
Stumbles and falls as the train speeds up, losing grip and being swallowed by the mob.
At the orphanage, maintains determination and does not let the bleak environment get to her, continues scrubbing and humming.
No noted immediate response or resistance shown toward the threatening figure (Comrade Phlemmenkof) entering the orphanage with a frightened child.
Protects Gregor by distracting and tripping Phlegmenkof to prevent harm to him.
Mimics Phlegmenkof's angry face to make other children laugh and lighten the mood.
Confronts Phlegmenkof to defend Gregor by telling her 'Don't touch him.'
Takes quick, clever action by shoving a scrub brush under Phlegmenkof's foot, causing her to fall and protecting Gregor.
Mimics Phlegmenkof with perfect angry gestures to make the other children laugh, showing quick wit and confidence.
Holds her ground when Phlegmenkof raises her hand to slap her, demonstrating courage and self-confidence.
Responds to Comrade Serebreakov's lecherous and threatening offer by insulting his smell, showing courage and defiance.
Mocks Phlegmenkof by imitating her, making the children laugh.
Responds boldly and cleverly to an intimidating figure (Comrade Serebreakov) with a sharp retort instead of showing fear or submissiveness.

Carefully fashions an escape rope from sheets and anchors it securely to climb out of a window.

Demonstrates uncertainty about her origins and future (expresses terror of the future and unsureness about home).

Hides her fear behind a brave facade, which later fades revealing vulnerability.

Encourages the children to be hopeful and independent if their origins remain unknown.

Leaps into the middle of a vicious dog pack to protect a small puppy.
